verses.text: 亞摩斯的兒子以賽亞得到默示，有關猶大和耶路撒冷：

words.note: Abbreviation for 彌迦書 (Míjiāshū).
Refers to divine revelation.

verses.text: 在末後的日子，耶和華殿的山，必被堅立，超乎眾山，必被高舉，過於萬嶺；萬國都要流歸這山。

words.note: Refers to the end times in biblical prophecy.
Refers to God; a transliteration of Yahweh.
Often used in a spiritual or foundational sense.
Often refers to divine exaltation.
Often refers to Gentile nations in a biblical context.

verses.text: 必有多國的人前來，說：「來吧！我們上耶和華的山，登雅各 神的殿；他必把他的道指教我們，我們也必遵行他的路。」因為訓誨必出於錫安，耶和華的話必來自耶路撒冷。

words.note: Refers to the God of Israel.
Often means God's divine way or truth.
Refers to following divine commands or ways.
Refers to divine instruction.

verses.text: 他要在列國施行審判，為多國的人斷定是非。他們必把刀打成犁頭，把矛槍打成鐮刀。這國不舉刀攻擊那國，他們也不再學習戰爭。

words.note: Similar to 萬國, refers to all nations/countries.
Often refers to divine judgment.

verses.text: 雅各家啊，來吧！我們要在耶和華的光中行走！

words.note: Here refers to the descendants of Jacob, the nation of Israel.
Figuratively refers to divine presence, guidance, or truth.

verses.text: 耶和華啊！你離棄了你的子民雅各家，是因為他們充滿了東方的迷信，和占卜的人，像非利士人一樣，並且與外族人擊掌交易。

words.note: The personal name of God.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Often refers to God's chosen people.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
Lit. 'lost belief' or 'delusional belief'.
To foretell fortune or predict future events.
Refers to non-Israelite people.
To strike hands as a sign of agreement or transaction.

verses.heading: The Lord’s Day of Judgment

verses.text: 他們的地滿了金銀，他們的財寶沒有窮盡，他們的地滿了馬匹，他們的車輛也無數。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
When used with 沒有, it means 'without end'.
Indicates completed action or change of state.
In biblical context, often refers to chariots.

verses.text: 他們的地滿了偶像；他們敬拜自己雙手所做的，就是他們的指頭所做的。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
Lit. 'image figure'
Forms a nominal phrase referring to what is done.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to what is done.

verses.text: 卑賤人向偶像俯首，尊貴人也降卑，所以不可饒恕他們。

words.note: Refers to people of low social standing.
Lit. 'image figure'
To lower one's head as a sign of respect or submission.
Refers to people of high social standing.
To lower one's status or position.

verses.text: 要進入巖洞，藏在泥土中；躲避耶和華的驚嚇和他威嚴的榮光。

words.note: The personal name of God.

verses.text: 到那日，眼目高傲的人必降卑，性情驕傲的人也必俯首，唯獨耶和華被高舉。

words.note: Often used in a metaphorical sense for spiritual vision.
Literally 'bend head', implying submission or humility.

verses.text: 因為萬軍之耶和華必有一日，要攻擊一切驕傲的、狂妄的，和所有高抬自己的，他們都要降卑。

words.note: Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to '的'.
Here, it forms 'those who' or 'the ones who'.

verses.text: 又要攻擊黎巴嫩所有高大的香柏樹，和巴珊所有的橡樹。
又攻擊所有的高山，和所有的峻嶺；

words.note: Literary term for mountain ranges or peaks.

verses.text: 攻擊每一個高臺，和每一道堅固的城牆；

words.note: Measure word for long, narrow things like walls, rivers, roads.

verses.text: 攻擊所有他施的船隻，和所有美麗的船。

words.note: 隻 is a measure word for animals, also used for ships/boats as a pluralizer here.

verses.text: 人的高傲必變為謙虛，人的狂妄都必降為卑微，在那日，唯獨耶和華被高舉。

words.note: Indicates a strong certainty or necessity.
Common phrase in prophetic biblical texts.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 偶像卻必全然消逝。
耶和華起來，使大地震動的時候，人必進入石洞，進入土穴，躲避耶和華的驚嚇和他威嚴的榮光。

words.note: Refers to Yahweh.

verses.text: 到那日，人必把那些自己所做、供自己敬拜的金偶像和銀偶像，拋給田鼠和蝙蝠。

words.note: Used to prepose the object of a verb for emphasis.
Used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase, similar to 'that which' or 'what'.

verses.text: 這樣，當耶和華起來，大地震動的時候，他們就能進入磐石縫中和巖石隙裡，躲避耶和華的驚嚇和他威嚴的榮光。

words.note: Introduces a temporal clause, similar to 'when'.
Can indicate rising physically or starting an action.
Common phrase structure to express 'when'.
Often used metaphorically for strength or refuge in scripture.
Combined 'crevice' and 'in'.
Similar to 磐石, but often implies a cliff or large exposed rock.
Combined 'cleft' and 'in'.
Here functions as a noun, referring to the terror caused by God.
Describes a solemn, commanding authority or grandeur.
Refers to divine glory or splendor.

verses.text: 你們不要倚靠世人，他的鼻孔裡只有一口氣息，他實在算得甚麼呢？

words.note: A strong negative imperative.
Often used in a spiritual context for trusting God or others.
Refers to people of the world, often contrasted with God.
口 (kǒu) functions as a measure word for mouthfuls or breaths.
Often refers to the fragility of human life, dependent on breath.
Part of the rhetorical question '算得甚麼呢?' (what is he worth?)
Used here to form a rhetorical question, implying insignificance.
